context_of_use: This use case allows customers and managers to manage product orders within the e-commerce system.
stakeholders_and_interests: customer: wants to efficiently manage orders
manager: wants to ensure timely order approvals
description: This use case enables customers to browse, search, view, add products to their cart, checkout, and track orders, while allowing managers to approve orders.
triggering_event: Customer or manager initiates order management actions.
preconditions: Customer is logged into the system.
Manager is logged into the system.
assumptions: Customers have access to the product catalog.
Managers have the authority to approve orders.
requirements_met: The system shall allow customers to browse products by category.
The system shall allow customers to search for products by keyword.
The system shall allow customers to view product details.
The system shall allow customers to add products to their cart.
The system shall allow customers to checkout using multiple payment methods.
The system shall allow customers to track their orders.
The system shall allow managers to approve orders.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the types of payment methods supported during checkout.
main_flow: 1. Customer browses products → System displays products by category.
2. Customer searches for products → System returns search results based on keywords.
3. Customer views product details → System displays detailed information about the selected product.
4. Customer adds products to cart → System updates the cart with the selected products.
5. Customer checks out order → System processes the order with selected payment method.
6. Customer tracks orders → System provides the current status of the customer's orders.
7. Manager approves orders → System updates order status to approved.
